values:
Last night, we went to the midnight (excuse me...12:04) showing of the new HP movie. (GOOD FLICK!).

We got to the theater about 10:00 so we had a good long time to hang out and do a whole lot of nothing. Luckily for me, they played just about every song I know, sans Josh of course but it was really fun, and I freaked out ever time I heard a song I knew. They played:

1) Manheim Steamroller "Good King Wencelaus...and something else...medley"
2) Randy and the Bloody Lovelies (I freaked out!) "Blue Horizons"
3) Chris Botti (he played something I know, but I don't know the name of the song)
4) Wicked "Popular" and "Defying Gravity"

So yeah, it was Heidi's favorite music night at the theater last night.


OOOOOOHHHHH!!!!!!!!!!! Before I forget.....





MI MANCHERI WAS FEATURED IN ONE OF THE PREVIEWS....I FLIPPED OUT......(Imagine me screaming for Josh Groban in a dark theater...yess.....that was me....but his voice is so....so.....*wow* in theaters!!) it's for a movie called "the lady of the mist" by M. Night Shamalan.

That's all for now...

-Me

Ok...no I'm not high. I just like that line from a song.

What does it feel like to be so numb to the outside world that you really don't care anymore? I don't know.

I'm such an exercise freak now, I've done Pilates three times...did it last night, this morning, and tonight. Whenever I feel alone or left out. I throw myself on my mat and stretch out. I work out all my negative energy until I'm so sore I can't move. Then I feel better.

Tomorrow on my list of to-do's is go to the clubs office and inquire about starting PBL, and see what other clubs I can join. I need more friends. I need different friends. I need to compete again.

Had lunch with Nick today again. I was just sitting at my table reading the paper like always and her he comes up behind me. So we talked, he makes me giggle. I like that.

Tonight in Core we ran real short so my teacher let us either leave or stay behind and she'd take us through a meditation. SO I stayed behind. I like to meditate...a LOT. First we just focused on our breathing, then she had family members come stand in front of us. My mom and dad came (in the meditation mind you...not in real life) and I got to chat with them for a while. It was so nice to feel their energy again. To feel all their love. To feel special. I got to hug my mom too. That felt good! Then afterwards we (there was like four of us and the teacher) sat around and just discussed where we went, and what we did. Then she asked us "Where are you at?" and I don't know what happened. She turned to me, looked me in the eye, and said "Heidi, where are you at?" and I flat out told her "I'm ready to go home." and right there in my core class I friggin started to cry. Not openly mind you, but I sure got the sniffles. You know what my teacher said? She said "I know, I could tell since a long time ago." which honestly kind of creepes me out, but I really don't care anymore.

Then I came back and was basically ignored for the whole night. Like always.

Let's go home kids....k?

-Heidi


p.s. I know these blogs have been REALLY depressive lately. I hope you guys can hang in there with me. I love to hear your feedback.


P.P.S. Jenni...can you make me a Michael Buble` layout for my LJ puh-leeze?

So I went to my astronomy workshop (lab) today and guess what?? THE PROF. CANCELLED CLASS NEXT TUESDAY!!! This means that I'll have NO classes at ALL next tuesday! *SO EXCITED*....so, after I left class today, I called my dad and told him. He was really excited....but you know what the cool part is?? We're gonna suprise my mom! It was my idea, and I told dad "dont tell anybody...just you and me". All I have to do is go to the Bus Depot in medford to get the ticket switched to the 6AM bus to portland on tuesday instead of wednesday. Keep your fingers crossed that the bus isn't full ok??

What else...

Ran into Nick last night coming back from core, we had the wierdest conversation...we kinda just stood there...actually here's the conversation....

Me: Hey! (turns down music)
Him: Hey Heidi (he likes my name for some reason)! Where you going?
Me: Oh nowhere, just got back from Core...I have it till eight.
Him: Oh ok....(silence, stares)
Me: (Silence...stares)
Me: Well...I have a lot of homework to do, so I better go.
Him: Ok bye!

and scene...

Anyway, was talking to maria today and apparently caitlin's bf said that maria and nick would be good for each other...whatever....she's always correcting him....anyway...:-)

I got a 84% on m last astronomy quiz! *SO EXCITED!* I went from a 64% on the first quiz, to another 64% on the second quiz to an 84% on yesterday's quiz!!! I'm so excited! so that means my class average went from a 64% to a 74% (he drops the lowest of the three quiz scores). So I'm doing the happy dance today let me tell you!

Did I tell you I got a 95% on my criminology midterm?? I did! I'm SO EXCITED for that too....PLUS he made a big project extra credit, and he pushed the due dates on out notebooks back to after thanksgiving too....

Academically I'm doing great, I'm so proud of myself.

I worked on Winter term forcasting today. If I get the classes that I want I'll be taking about 16 credits next term so that means that I'll have a total of 28 credits at the end of winter term, so by then end of spring term I should have the 30 credits I need to transfer to PSU next year. Which I think I may do...it's just easier to focus on my work at home, plus some of my old friends from Scappoose that go there havve been trying to get ahold of me. Plus the rest of my friends from St. Helens pretty much stayed nearby so I'll be closer to them too. I think as far as a college experience, SOU was perfect for me to do that. I met people, I got involved....and who knows I may get an apartment here next year...I still have two more terms to meet people...I'm not worried yet. But see if I stay here next year, a lot of my friends will be gone. Because most of them have decided to go elsewhere too.

Il Divo's coming to portland on the 23rd of february and I can't go see them!! *BAH!*

But back to winter term stuff....my week is going to be screwed up! I'll have 5 classes on Mondays and Wednesdays, one on thursdays and fridays, and no classes on friday. I think it'sll give me plenty of time to study and stuff, so I think it just looks menacing on paper.

Going to a Pro-Choice student group tonight, looking forward to it!

Ok...going to work on my CORE paper now....

Heidi


P.S. Emma...it's me...Heidi...from school....SHHS...yess you know who!!

Ahhh, 

So FBLA state was this past sunday-tuesday. Got 3rd in computer apps. no Natl's for me this year...ahhh well onwards an upwards!

-Heidi
